issue.title: More of a question than issue

content.raw:
Hi Mateusz,

thank you for using Pyteomics and for your kind feedback.

The m/z and intensities from each scan are decoded from binary as numpy arrays, rather than one by one, so no direct iterator is available.
You can emulate it by using `zip()` on the two arrays, though it won't save any RAM.

Best regards,
Lev
content.html:
Hi Mateusz,

thank you for using Pyteomics and for your kind feedback.

The m/z and intensities from each scan are decoded from binary as numpy arrays, rather than one by one, so no direct iterator is available. You can emulate it by using zip() on the two arrays, though it won't save any RAM.

Best regards, Lev
